noun.description: A covered walk in a convent, monastery, college, or cathedral, typically with a wall on one side and a colonnade open to a quadrangle on the other.

verb.description: Seclude or shut up in or as if in a convent or monastery.
examples: the monastery was where the Brothers would cloister themselves to meditate

origin: Middle English (in the sense place of religious seclusion): from Old French cloistre, from Latin claustrum, clostrum lock, enclosed place, from claudere, to close.
